perturbation.original_text: This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Japan.
perturbation.changed_text: This Amendment shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of Delaware.
perturbation.explanation: Changing the governing law from Japan to Delaware could remove consumer protections afforded under Japanese law, especially concerning contract termination and liability. Delaware law might not provide the same level of protection to counterparties as Japanese law.
perturbation.law_explanation: The Consumer Contract Act in Japan protects consumers from unfair contract terms. By changing the governing law to Delaware, where consumer contract laws may differ, these protections could be weakened or eliminated, creating a legal risk for counterparties who might otherwise benefit from Japanese law.

perturbation.original_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 and 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: Notwithstanding Article 1.1, Article 1.2 and Article 1.3 above, the Nissin Parties agree to cause each of VNBJ and VNBZ to comply with Sections 4.3.2 of the JV Agreement with respect to the indemnification or reimbursement, as applicable, of all Directors and Officers (except those individuals resigning pursuant to Section 6.2.6 of the VNBJ SPA and Section 6.2.6 of the VNBZ SPA) with respect to any Liabilities arising prior to the VNBJ Closing or the VNBZ Closing, as applicable.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the reference to Section 4.3.3 of the JV Agreement, the contract potentially omits a crucial provision regarding the standard of care required of directors and officers, and thus their indemnification rights. This could contradict legal requirements concerning fiduciary duty and indemnification under Japanese Company Law, especially if Section 4.3.3 outlines specific requirements.
perturbation.law_explanation: Article 423 of the Companies Act addresses the liability of directors and officers for damages. Omitting a section related to indemnification might undermine the legal framework for director/officer liability and protection, potentially violating the spirit and intent of the Companies Act regarding corporate governance and accountability, as well as impact minority shareholder rights.
